Section.Caption: Welcome to the OpenCms template development guide!

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
This guide introduces the relevant concepts needed to build an OpenCms website template from scratch.

A template contains all the things necessary to render a website nicely and to make it possible for editors to add new contents to a website in a user-friendly way.

Since OpenCms is a Java servlet which uses Java Server Pages (JSP) for template development and the XML Schema language for content type definition, some basic knowledge of JSP, HTML, CSS, and XML is recommended to understand this guide.

There are several possibilites to read this guide. If you are new to OpenCms, you should read it like a book from begin to end. Indeed, the chapters built upon each other. You cannot understand the details of developing a formatter without a basic understanding of what a content type and a template JSP is, and so on. If you are an already experienced OpenCms developer, it is also possible to read selected chapters only. Each chapter starts with simple examples about a specific topic but then gets more and more advanced. Thus, experienced developers will especially win from the back subchapters.

Each chapter contains examples. The full source code for each example is available on GitHub. It is also possible to install the examples into a local OpenCms installation. In this way, you can try out and modify the examples while reading the guide. If this is your aim, please make sure that your local installation is running on http://localhost/ at the best and you can log in to the OpenCms workplace.

Some subchapters invite the reader to actively reproduce an example. There is no development environment needed for this puropse. One can use OpenCms' built-in editing tools. The reader is invited to make himself familiar with the editing features of the OpenCms explorer and the sitemap editor before reading this guide.
